intro: Fagonia soturbensis, commonly known as the Soturben fagonia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cactaceae. It is native to the arid regions of northern Chile, where it thrives in harsh, dry environments. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom during the cooler months. It has adapted to survive with minimal water, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
